column4: err.  im trying to toss dapper onto a spare partition, using the live cd. when i get to setting up partitions, gparted spits out errors about one of my many fat32 partitions having errors.  i have chkdsk /f'ed drives C, D, G, H and I. WinXP reports that theyre all fine. :| Also, it's spitting out a message about partition 0,0,0.  does that make sense to anyone? :P
could my problem stem from the fact that i am trying to install to an external eSATA drive? or should that not be an issue?
warbler > why would it be seeing my mobo as a partition?
i was thinking that :P  but i was hoping that was not the case. thank youuuuuuuuu.
the mbr - master boot record - is the first section on hard drive
errr i dont know why i typed mobo
can you - in bios - select to boot from usb?
warbler > of course i can but why would i do that?
how do you - at boot - get the comp to recognise the external drive - that is what you want - yes?
warbler > the computer recognizes the drive fine at boot.
my issue is that gparted is telling me there are errors with a fat partition, and then saying something about 0,0,0
sounds like your master boot record is broke - have same prob - gparted only sees my disk as mt
if my MBR was broke, wouldnt i have issue booting into the Win OS and 2 distros that i've got installed?
I triple boot with no probs - just can't change partitions cause gparted can't see them
it seems to pick my partitions up without a hitch. theyre all listed, and everything it list is correct.
